Pre-Game Insights: India, West Indies look at the long term
India are looking to try out personnel for the 2024 T20 World Cup, handing Yashasvi Jaiswal a debut
Tilak Varma has emerged as a strong candidate for the No. 4 slot in the ODI squad
India don't have a left-hander in their first-choice top six in ODIs
If picked, Tilak can fill that void
India can test him further in the Asia Cup
West Indies are rebuilding their T20I side under Rovman Powell
West Indies beat South Africa 2-1 in March and have a chance to win back-to-back T20I series for the first time since 2017
West Indies LWWWL (last five completed T20Is, most recent first)
India WLLWW
In the spotlight - Shimron Hetmyer and Shubman Gill
Shimron Hetmyer has looked off-colour in the ODI series
Shubman Gill finished the ODI series as the second-highest run-getter
West Indies can also consider bringing in Shai Hope for one of Brandon King and Johnson Charles

West Indies (probable): 1 Kyle Mayers, 2 Brandon King, 3 Johnson Charles, 4 Nicholas Pooran (wk), 5 Rovman Powell (capt), 6 Shimron Hetmyer, 7 Jason Holder/Roston Chase, 8 Romario Shepherd, 9 Akeal Hosein, 10 Alzarri Joseph, 11 Obed McCoy
Expect India to stick with the same XI that won them the third T20I

India (probable): 1 Yashasvi Jaiswal, 2 Shubman Gill, 3 Suryakumar Yadav, 4 Tilak Varma, 5 Sanju Samson (wk), 6 Hardik Pandya (capt), 7 Axar Patel, 8 Kuldeep Yadav, 9 Arshdeep Singh, 10 Mukesh Kumar, 11 Yuzvendra Chahal
Pitch and conditions
Teams batting first have won 11 of the 13 completed T20Is played here
A 47% chance of rain in the afternoon may be a temptation for chasing
Yuzvendra Chahal needs five wickets to become the first Indian, and eighth overall, to take 100 T20I wickets
Charles is 12 away from becoming the ninth West Indies batter to 1000 T20I runs
This is India's fifth T20I series under Hardik Pandya. They are yet to lose one
